records.story: One big fireball look that broke off into upside down l formstion where there was 4 then. It looked like a tear drop fireball that broke apart into 3 they was steady moving south in the sky they went out one at a time and when they lite back up they were in formation of a upside down l but this time four appeared instead of 3 they stayed in perfect formation in the sky for about five minutes until they finally shot off real fast and dissapered they moved perfectly down central avenue all the way to frank road to where they finally shot off and disappeared.

records.summary: Four round white lights seen making patterns by the South Drive-In Theater in Columbus, Ohio.
records.story: Four round white lights seen making patterns by the South Drive-In Theater in Columbus, Ohio. My husband, our son, my brother, and I were at the South Drive-In Theater in Columbus, Ohio, on Saturday, July 6, 2013, about to watch a movie around 9:20pm when over in the southern sky, under the clouds, we saw four round white lights in the sky.   We were facing west towards screen 1.  The sun had already set in the west but there was still a sliver of light in the western sky. These four lights were in lateral wavy line.  Then they moved into a triangle formation.  Each of the three round lights were at each point of the triangle and the fourth went to the left of the triangle and it's light went out.  They were in the triangle formation for about 5-10 seconds.   Then they went into a straight vertical line along with the fourth joining the three, which the fourth lit back up to get into formation.  They were in that pattern for about 10-15 seconds.   Then they dispersed from the pattern laterally from one another, however staying relatively close to each other.   All four of them started to descend in altitude until we could see them no more due to the tree line.   The whole duration was approximately 3-4 minutes.  We could tell these lights were several miles away and that they flew with a purpose, not a random act.  They flew at a leisurely pace.  I knew they were not fireworks and they were not planes.  There were people shooting off fireworks on the other side of the South Drive-In Theater.  There was also a commercial jet flying to the southwest of the four UFO's, heading southeast during the time the four lights were in the sky.  Afterward, there were two helicopters that flew over to where the four UFO's had been.  The helicopters seem to be searching for while.  They searched for approximately 10 minutes or so.  Although, we did not pay much attention to the helicopters after that.  I've never seen anything like this before.  All four of us saw them.  A lady in a car next to us was recording them with her cell phone after I pointed them out.  I hope she puts the video on YouTube.  I did not have anything to video record the four lights unfortunately.

records.summary: 4 Red lights viewed from Binns Blvd and Briggs Rd to the south east in Columbus, OH.
records.story: 4 Red lights viewed from Binns Blvd and Briggs Rd to the south east in Columbus, OH On 07/06/2013 at 9:40 PM My self and 3 other people were standing outside at 1021 Binns Blvd and we all witnessed 4 red lights formed in an arc or half circle in the direction of the south east looking over Binns Elementary which upon a closer look appeared to be near or over the power lines and / or cell towers to the south east.  The lights were stationary for a while then the bottom one moved in a downward direction and then the other 3 followed in the same direction.   All 4 of us saw the same thing.

records.summary: 4 glowing lights in sky
records.story: 4 glowing lights in sky Just south of Columbus near 71.  Four glowing objects in the sky.  One disappeared, second disappeared then all four appeared together again.  Then vanished. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: 4 orange lights moving quickly forming different shapes in the sky
records.story: 4 orange lights moving quickly forming different shapes in the sky As we were driving home I noticed out of the corner of my eye something that looked like a firework.   It was one orange dot in the sky that separated into 3 all of a sudden after separating the objects started circling eachother And moving pretty fast.   They dissappeared once and when it came back there were four.   They started making a constellation shape straight up and down and the after about 4 minutes disappeared altogether.  Never a believer until 9:50 tonight.

records.summary: 4 hover lights in sky!
records.story: 4 hover lights in sky! me my brother and mom were driving home. we see something so I say what is that.  my mom says fireworks but then I noticed they were hovering.  we pulled over ON 71 and they SPLIT into 3!! I blink and theirs 4.  they are there moving down. look again, there gone.  look again their all back and they are hovering over downtown Columbus!!!  they hover for about 30-40 secs and they disappear!  next thing you know there are helicopters swarming!!!

records.summary: Strange glowing fireball/orange object moving quickly in Columbus, OH.
records.story: Strange glowing fireball/orange object moving quickly in Columbus, OH Looking east the night of September 1 there was a very strange orange ball shaped object heading due north that we could see from my uncle's patio.  It looked like something on fire very high up in the air.  It looked to be about the height of a helicopter but there was no sound.  There a a lot of trees in the neighborhood and it went behind some heading east and gaining altitude. We went to the front yard where the object seemed to be much higher at this point and had turned heading northeast.  My uncle said it seemed to be changing course as it went.  There was not a trail behind it like you would expect if it was on fire and moving as quickly as it was.  The intensity of the orange/fire would change as well and when it started heading northeast it looked more like a light than a fire.  Columbus is very close to a major airport and we get planes all the time, there were planes much higher so we could compare the lights and sound and there was no sound coming off this object.  And no blinking lights as with aircraft.

records.summary: Strange lights over the sky in northwest Columbus
records.story: Strange lights over the sky in northwest Columbus Driving home from dinner out, we saw a number of strange lights in the sky over northwest Columbus.  There were a whole bunch, all remaining stationary above the buildings and trees, too bright and low to be stars.  They were a light orange in color.  We were able to see them from several perspectives as we got off I-270 and headed north on Rt. 23.  We couldn't identify them.  If they were all part of one aircraft it would have been huge.  If they were all individual aircrafts there were a lot of them.  Yet they didn't move.

records.summary: Dogs started barking then a Huge triangle blue flash right over house  we both felt tingling through our body as if we were being scann
records.story: Dogs started barking then a Huge triangle blue flash right over house  we both felt tingling through our body as if we were being scanned then everything was silent  then all of the dogs just stopped

records.summary: Bright amber lights travelling toward airport and army base
records.story: Bright amber lights travelling toward airport and army base I was in the process of getting a few items out of my car before going into the back yard and sit by the pool, admire the full moon, and make a phone call.  I don't recall why I looked up into the sky but I looked up and there were two amber colored lights floating across the sky.   A small airport is 2-3 miles away so I am accustomed to seeing objects in the sky but nothing like this. I have been an airplane buff since I was a kid and, even as an adult, I still look up to the sky when aircraft pass over.  I know that airplanes have red and green blinking lights and that's what caught my attention, the fact that they were steady lights and amber-colored.  They looked to be fairly low-flying, perhaps no more than 500 ft above me and flying over the spot 200 yards away from where I was standing. As I saw these two lights coming in my direction, at first I thought, "That is something big, because I was thinking it was the lights on the front of a plane's landing gear.   But then I could determine space between the two lights, with sky in the background, and I realized it was two separate entities. I listened for sound but heard absolutely nothing.  No propeller, no jet engine, zero sound.  Even with the light of a full moon, I could not determine the shape of any sort of craft.  They just looked like two bright lights floating across the sky. The lights were traveling at a steady velocity and did not deviate from each other. They were traveling towards the southwest, directly at the airport.  Also in the southwest direction, a few miles beyond the airport, is a large U.S. Army base.  Thus, at the time, I thought I was seeing some sort of experimental military aircraft. I watched the lights for as long as I could see them. They seemed to slow down as they approached the approximate vicinity of the airport but that may have simply been an illusion as they got farther away from me. Eventually, they were hidden by the trees and I could no longer see them so I don't know what direction/action they took once they reached the airport.

records.summary: Huge light cluster (possible ufos).
records.story: Huge light cluster (possible ufos) Driving down the road, saw about 12-18 white/red lights forming in a zig-zag formation. All clustered together.  When the white lights went away the red lights replaced them.  The lights stayed in the sky for about 5 minutes.   Following them in the sky was what looked like a helicopter/plane with its search light on pointing right at them.   We got out of the car and ran to see if we could still see them there were only about 4 left then they completely disappeared.   The helicopter/plane with its search light on was the only thing left in the sky.

records.summary: Three red-lighted objects forming a triangle shape in the sky moves around and then disappears!
records.story: Three red-lighted objects forming a triangle shape in the sky moves around and then disappears! We saw three red lights in the sky, we thought it was a new tower in the area until we realized that it definitely wasn't.  We kept looking at it trying to figure out why there were these objects or one big object in the sky.   As we kept watching, the whole thing seemed to hover down towards the ground (but at this point it was obviously in the sky, behind some buildings).  They seemed to disappear, and a few minutes later, all three came back up into our view.   The shape was in the shape of a triangle, and as it hovered back up farther in the sky, the triangle shape became somewhat distorted.   There were three different red things slowly getting higher in the sky, as they slowly, one-by-one, faded out into nothing.

records.summary: UFO Over Columbus, GA.
records.story: UFO Over Columbus, GA As I stopped at a red light to turn onto Manchester Boulevard from Highway 80/22 going North, I saw an object flying toward the area I was in.  There were small, 2 round, red lights, 2 small green lights in a square formation, flying erratically, then pausing above us. It hovered for a bit, then went behind trees. My two boys saw it, too.

records.summary: Large formation of 15-20 small white glowing orbs heading northward, vanished.
records.story: large formation of 15-20 small white glowing orbs heading northward, vanished -- my partner was napping on our bed and i came in to plug my cellphone in, and happened to be down close to the floor to find the plug. i looked up out of the window and saw what looked like a BEAUTIFUL formation of white shimmering birds -- i yelled at my partner to sit up & put his glasses on to see. then i looked closer and saw that there were LIGHTS, glowing lights. they were moving NORTH over our building in victorian village, columbus. my partner couldn't see them so we RAN outside to try to find them as they headed over the building. ran all around the block, every which way, and no sign of any of the lights. they were neither in a 'V'-formation or a straight line -- a sort of very intricate inter-woven pattern, diamonds maybe?, that i'd have to see again to describe. strangely enough we'd BOTH seen the exact same thing with 2 other witnesses in a columbus-area grocery store on the day neil armstrong died. looked it up all over the internet & nothing ever explained. (august 25th, 2012). very, very moved by & curious about these lights. would love to know if anybody else has seen them today. (no chem/vapor trails in the sky, either ... )

records.summary: 5 balls of fire in the sky flying in formation.
records.story: 5 balls of fire in the sky flying in formation I saw 5 balls of fire traveling due east from downtown.  The balls of fire remained in 1 formation for the 3 minute sighting.   My initial thought was that they were Chinese lanterns, but they seemed to make the same movements as if they were attached by a string.  They faded away into the clouds. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Shape shifting Light Orbs.
records.story: Shape shifting Light Orbs First, felt compelled to turn around and look at sky while out canoeing on a small lake.  We saw what looked like 3 to 5 dark orange hovering orbs still and silent.  Position was N to Ne just above tree line. Next, as we turned canoe to get a better look the large low hovering orbs began to float up and away glowing like Chinese lanterns.  However, we knew they were not.  At first they looked like large oval glowing jellyfish then appeared to shift into a more lantern like shape as they floated upwards silently. The third phase was when they appeared smaller and more brightly colored but were still much bigger and lower than stars.  They locked into a formation at about fifty degrees above the horizon and floated in that formation more directly north.  This formation looked like the top of Orion the Hunter, or possibly a circular form with a shape inside it much like an arrow or cross.  Unfortunately part of this formation was hidden behind a building on the end of the lake so we couldn't fully make it out. The next phase of this encounter was 8 to 10 stars looking like they were blinking in multi colored lights much like Christmas lights.  Their appearance in size was at least 10 to 20 times larger than an actual star would appear.  It would be comparable to holding a dime about a foot in front of your eye, but a little more cylindrical.  They resembled radio stars in they way they flashed multiple colors blue, white , red , yellow, green.  They danced around each other like bees over flowers in silent circles somewhat erratic in this pattern as if they were swirling around each other. Finally they organized once again and formed a perfect hatchet shape with the rectangular piece facing west at the top and a long handle on the right or east side each dot representing a light bright type of design of perfect angles to create a clear shape.  They flashed a couple of times as though to show off their display, or the final act of this show. Lastly they filed slowly out of the hatchet type of shape drifting off to the Northwest sky, up and away.  They almost seemed to puff out one by one like a burnt out firework.  We were so transfixed at this point we didn't want the experience to end.  They seemed to possess an intelligence.  They seemed to know we were watching.  One final light lingered as we focused on it, then disappeared into the NW along with the others.

records.summary: 1 bright white and four smaller orange orbs.
records.story: 1 bright white and four smaller orange orbs I have been watching these lights in the sky for almost ten years, but this is the first time I have ever seen more than one at a time.   I went outside this morning at 3 AM EST and saw the main light first.  It is very bright and seems ‘lower’ than I’ve ever seen it.  There are “beams” radiating from it. It moves around slowly and looks like it’s part of a constellation at first.  It is VERY bright.  It is in the western sky. There are four more lights randomly placed in the same western sky.  They are smaller and appear orange.  They move around more noticeably than the centrally located white light. It is now 5:20 AM EST, and they are all still in the sky.  Normally, if I see a moving light it disappears after an hour or so.  Not this time.  I wonder why there is so much activity?

records.summary: Unusual cloud formation I had never seen before low in the sky south of the city of Columbus, Ohio.
records.story: Unusual cloud formation I had never seen before low in the sky south of the city of Columbus, Ohio. There appeared to be a layered oval shaped cloud at low altitude.  Very unusual sighting, but I did not notice any other objects in the area.  It seemed to just be hanging there and didn't move.  I had to leave the area and when I returned about 1/2 hour later it had gone away. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness indicates that the date of the incident is approximate.  PD))

records.summary: 5 slow moving fireballs.
records.story: 5 slow moving fireballs I was Driving down I-270 going southbound tonight around 9:15 or so.  I was looking ahead and happen to look up and saw like 5 lights looking like balls of fire.  Orangish in color.   I thought it was a plane at first but then I saw them like in an odd line and one had veered in front and catty corner to the others.  They were going northwest bound.   I thought I was seeing things but other vehicles were slowing down as well. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Nine small balls of light with tails in arrow formation.  These were flying horizontally across the sky.  Color was greenish orange.
records.story: Nine small balls of light with tails in arrow formation. These were flying horizontally across the sky.  There color was greenish orange.  They stayed in a uniform formation, although it was obvious that they each were separate entities.  They flew horizontally and then suddenly ramped upward and climbed until they simply and suddenly disappeared.  They appeared to be traveling extremely fast.  They completely cover the entire sky from horizon to horizon in seconds.

records.summary: UFOs in formation both stationary and moving, over columbus ohio 8:45 pm.
records.story: ufos in formation both stationary and moving, over columbus ohio 8:45 pm We were lying on a sleeping bag with a tarp under it waiting for clintonville (metro columbus fireworks. 8:35pm. still daylight.  we had very good binoculars with us. one object appeared, round, high up, very obviously not an airplane. we watched it through binocs it changed color and moved slowly aross the sky NW to SE perhaps 15 degrees then returned and was stationary. we would estimate this object to have been at 8000-9000 feet. it continued to change color red blue yellow.  then three more identical ones appeared just southeast of where the stationary one was, and the three were in a perfect triangular formation. identical in size and shape to the first one, and changing color.  very obviously a formation. we watched this through binoculars for at least two-three minutes. then all four moved southeast, the three staying in formation and the first one off behind. they then moved to a higher altitude and were no longer visible.  a number of people saw this.  we dont know if anyone else watched it through binoculars. one of us is an MD one of us owns a financial advisory company.

records.summary: Green fireball flew over downtown
records.story: Green fireball flew over downtown Just saw a fireball like green orb fly very quickly over downtown.  It had a slight tale and was heading north toward the Great Lakes.   It literally happened so quick but it was flying way to low to be anything else.   Lived in the same apartment for 3 years and have only ever seen orange orbs, this was the first green one.

records.summary: Floating disk with red, yellow, green, and white lights appeared and then vanished with a small white flash but NO noise.
records.story: Floating disk with red, yellow, green, and white lights appeared and then vanished with a small white flash but NO noise. I was sitting on my porch in my backyard hanging out with friends when I looked up at the sky and I saw a round dick looking object floating in the sky.   Some neighbors were setting off fire crackers a few yards down so I originally thought what I was seeing was a fire cracker, however that wasn't the case.   This object was floating in one place in the sky and was making no noise whatsoever.  It had alternating green, yellow, white, and red lights circling around the exterior of the object, this was how I observed the shape - round disk/saucer.   It stayed there for maybe a total of 10 seconds and then it just disappeared with a small white flash, but no noise coinciding with its departure.   My neighbors continued to set off fire crackers for the rest of the night but I never saw anything again like what I had seen for that brief 10 seconds.

records.summary: While travelling through Columbus, Ohio, saw a bright object break into 3 pieces go dark and reappear as 6.
records.story: While travelling through Columbus, Ohio, saw a bright object break into 3 pieces go dark and reappear as 6. I was driving my family from Seymour Indiana to New Hampshire on vacation which requured is to go through columbus Ohio.  I was driving north on I 71 north just south of the city looking for my next turn to continue on 71n when I noticed a bright object to my left, NW about 11 in the sky at a high but undetermined altitude.  I thought it was a meteor or comet because of the intensity of the light and it appeared to have a tail behind the head.  I yelled to my family to see it and they did. I yelled for them to video it which two of them did.  Instead of one object it suddenly broke into three pieces and continued falling and then they disappeared for a brief moment and the sky went dark and then suddenly 6 light appeared with odd shapes like a triangle and I thought it might be a parachute drill team, but they started moving around in an irregular pattern which made me think debris again until they came together in a line and came down together until they all went dark at the same time and did not twinkle or go out like a flare, or one at a time.   They all suddenly vanished at the same time.   We have video and cannot find out anything on this via news or reports which makes me wonder what we witnessed.  I would like help in knowing and where to have the video reviewed

records.summary: Reddish orbs flying low altitude Columbus, OH.
records.story: Redish orbs flying low altitude Columbus, OH My family and I were waiting for the fireworks to start and we look up and notice a red orb (fireball) flying towards us from the NE moving in a SW pattern and is slowly drifted over us and then disappeared.   This orb was higher in altitude than the ones I was the weekend prior while camping in Lakeview, OH.  All the objects I have seen in the past week have been round and red.  Wonder if these are drones? ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Several red orange lights in arch formation.
records.story: Several red orange lights in arch formation. Several round red orange circles in an arch.  Slowly separated and dimmed and brightened.  Some at very high altitude.  Lights disappeared as we got closer.   As we followed the last light it faded out and wevcould see the oval silhouette as it moved away slowly and then took off at a high rate of speed.   One of the other lights went straight up when we drove under  and then took off very quickly in the other direction.   Asked locals at a nearby store on the west side about the lights. They told us friends frontage east side had also seen lights earlier in the night.

records.summary: Line of bright white, flashing lights. No sound, despite seemingly low altitude.
records.story: Line of bright white, flashing lights. No sound, despite seemingly low altitude. At approximately 10:30 PM EST, on 7/16/2014, I looked up to witness a 'line' of flashing lights in the sky.  My view was not obscured by any trees or other objects, and the sky was clear.   The lights were not flashing in a synchronized fashion, but seemed to be blinking on and off independently of one another, with each doing so at fairly regular intervals of every two seconds or so.  The lights seemed to be close to the ground, but - sans a point of reference to judge distance by - I only say that because of how large and bright they were.  There were perhaps eight to ten lights that I could see all at once, stretching from a point directly overhead, from north to south, until the roof of my apartment building blocked my view.   I watched this go on for around fifteen seconds, then realized that the number of lights seemed to be decreasing; it did not look as if they were ascending, or flying away outside of my field of vision, but rather that every few 'blinks', one of the lights would not light up again. At that point I ran inside to get my fiance.   When we got back outside, we went directly to the rear (south) of our apartment building. Since the 'line' stretched in that direction, and presumably beyond my line of sight, I assumed we would have a better view of whatever lights remained from that vantage.  This turned out to be the case, as we BOTH still saw four or five of the lights - as well as a single plane flying east to west at a higher altitude than the lights were when I originally saw them - flashing on and off.  Only, by this time, they were much further away from our location, and seemed to be at a higher altitude. Our view was also obscured at that point by a number of trees.  My fiance still definitely saw them as well, though I wish she could have seen them as I originally had.  (For the last hour and a half, I've been constantly refreshing local news sights and google searches, hoping to find a similar report from someone local.  So far I've seen nothing.  But what I have found is a video from San Diego that shows nearly exactly what I saw, only in that video the lights were at a greater height:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ot9R6wE4Wtw  And a picture that looks remarkably similar to what I saw during the brief times when all of the 'objects' were lit up simultaneously:  http://humboldtsentinel.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/11/ufo-blinking-lights.bmp)  The lights were bright white in color.  No sounds whatsoever.

records.summary: Erratic Light Moves Across Sky and Stops Overhead.
records.story: Erratic Light Moves Across Sky and Stops Overhead. I saw a tiny white dot come across the sky from low on the horizon as it were a plane or a star.  It was silent and slowed to a stop a few degrees southeast of the field I was in and appeared to drift rapidly from side to side, speed up, and slow down moving rapidly in different directions at a very high altitude.  It continued moving from east to west in an erratic manner far above the clouds with no jet trails or sound.  The object would appear to stop and then dart rapidly as it were moving very fast but over a very small arc less than a tenth of a degree.  It gradually seemed to drift south of me from east to west but approached the area I was in more rapidly slowing almost to a stop.  It was partly cloudy and there were no stars in the sky.  The sun had set half an hour before. It was around 9:45 PM. At one point it was moving so slowly I thought it might be moving in the opposite direction it came but there was definitely a subtle and rapid darting from side to side.  I noticed nothing else in the sky that seemed to reflect or emit light at the time.  The dot may have had a slightly yellowish tint.  What was unusual was that it seemed to approach the field I was in very rapidly as though it were a plane traveling in one direction and once it were about three or four degrees southeast of me it stopped and drifted very slowly darting around erratically but subtly.  I got tired of watching it as it moved slowly south and west from me continuing the erratic darting and slowing as it were not moving quickly enough across the sky for me to watch it go to the horizon.  I could not identify the object.  It could have been a satellite or space station or something not extraterrestrial, but what was unusual was that it had slowed and stopped a few degrees from where I was and darted around.

records.summary: Six orange lights falling in a z pattern.
records.story: Six orange lights falling in a z pattern We saw six lights appear about two miles west of our house.  They were too bright and lasted too long to be fireworks.  My boyfriend had time to see them and run inside to grab his phone and see the rest of the descent.  Some went out and relit.   They fell in a zig zag pattern one behind the other equidistant from each other rather slow going north then west like a z.   They were bright orange.   Too low and slow to be jets or planes.   Completely baffled a UFO is the only explanation.   They vanished still descending into the tree line.

records.summary: Directly overhead, stationary.  Reddish-orange slowly pulsating light then moved south very rapidly.
records.story: Directly overhead, stationary. reddish-orange slowly pulsating light then moved south very rapidly. Hello, in 1966 my brother and I both had morning paper routes and lived on the west side of Columbus, Ohio, at the corner of Briggs Road and Wedgewood Drive. I don’t know the exact time but it was dark outside as we delivered our papers and returned home.  I also don’t remember the time of year but it seems to me it was summer. As we stepped out of the back door of our apartment building, there was an object directly overhead and was stationary.  The object made no noise and it was reddish-orange in color. It would vary in light intensity slowly. I said to my brother, “What’s that?” (more of a statement than a question) and he replied, “I don’t know, the moon I guess.”  Well, it wasn’t the moon because the moon was out and high in the sky to the north of us. The size of this object was large.  I will attempt to describe the size as being the size of the moon as it appears at moon rise on the horizon but this was directly overhead. Anyway, I was just curious as to whether or not you have any other reports from roughly that time frame. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness indicates that the date of the event is approximate.  PD))

records.summary: Dozens of flickering fast moving lights.
records.story: dozens of flickering fast moving lights Swiftly moving flickering lights in clusters and several formations, several two-by-two.  Headed from the north toward the south.  Mostly bright white, but some flickered red and yellow and white.  No discernible noise.   All lights were moving in relative unison at the same speed.  Looked almost like they were "moving down-river" as if on a current.  There seemed to be several dozen lights flying not too high above the tree tops.

records.summary: It was at a high altitude.  Bright light traveling west.  Very quick eradic path.
records.story: It was at a high altitude.   Bright light traveling west.  Very quick eradic path.

records.summary: Dark object, three lights on side, moving quickly.
records.story: Dark object, three lights on side, moving quickly. Triangle shape with three lights on the side, making sharp turns that a plane could not make. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides little contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Silver object that jumped across the sky so many feet. It moved very quickly would disappear and reappear. Then its gone.
records.story: Silver object that jumped across the sky so many feet. It moved very quickly would disappear and reappear. Then its gone. I was driving home from work heading 70 East.  The sky was clear without many clouds.  I seen a bright light and it was the reflection of the sunshine on an object.  It was silver and it just jumped across the sky.  It would disappear and reappear so many feet across.  Moved very quickly and then it was gone.

records.story: the morning 1024 14 at 8:45 in the morningI was taking a break looking up at the eastern sky and took these pictures what are they do you know.

records.summary: Fifty feet from my driveway, up to my left, out of the north sky came a large lighted object.
records.story: In the summer of 1967, I lived north of Columbus, Ohio, on East Powell Road, half a mile east of I71.  Houses were on long, narrow ten acre lots - about two tenths of a mile up a hill on the edge of the woods.   I was fifteen years old and regularly sneaking out - no fear!   I was walking home alone at 1 am.  Fifty feet from my driveway, up to my left, out of the north sky came a large lighted object..  It stopped in mid air just past the edge of the woods.  Scared, I hid behind a large oak tree peeking, not knowing what to do.  It made no noise - no movement. I knew "they" knew I was there, so I ran up the driveway stopping in front of my house.  Approx one- two hundred feet away at tree top level was a saucer shaped aircraft with pale colored, rectangular lights around the bottom.  The lights were white, red, blue, and glowing.  Maybe an acre in size - it just stayed there. I didn't dare move - it came to me "they" wouldn't hurt me.  Who were "! they"?  It finally moved at the same level slowly south parallel to I71, with a slight up and down motion.  On top of the hill, I could see it for maybe a few miles and it made three loud, high pitched, whirling noises and went straight down.  I had left my friends house at 1am, when I next looked at the time it was 3 am.  A short time later I saw headlines in the Columbus dispatch where an airforce pilot reported a UFO sighting.  I had my proof.  Now I always wonder.. where did 2 hours go during the time I was outside with the ufo?  Could I have been upducted? records.summary: Two consecutive pairs of lights drop quickly from high altitude then disappear on a horizontal path.
records.story: Two consecutive pairs of lights drop quickly from high altitude then disappear on a horizontal path. In far distance west of Columbus, two lights appeared to be descending rapidly toward where the sun had just set.  The lights converged and became one light, then fading out more and more, with two lights appearing again.  Then two more lights descended rapidly on the same trajectory.  The lights became less bright as the first two lights had done.  My impression is that the objects were descending vertically, but then quickly transitioned to a horizontal flight path, and at a very high speed continued westward.  It will be interesting to read whether others saw this in states just west of Ohio. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Bright white cross with flashing blue/red lights moved slowly away at an acute angle of ascent in early morning hours
records.story: Bright white cross with flashing blue/red lights moved slowly away at an acute angle of ascent in early morning hours Friday morning the sun was just beginning to come up; there very few clouds and the sky was just beginning to turn blue. There were no other stars visible anymore so it caught my eye that there was a very large, very bright star off to the Southwest in the sky. Except when I looked closer at it, it was flickering incredibly fast between mostly white, but also blue and red. The lights flickered for the duration of the event. It then occurred to me that the shape was not regular for a star and rather than a dot, it was a long cross-like shape.  At first it appeared stationary, but then I found a place to view it where I could set it against a stationary object in the foreground, and observed it was actually moving. It listed to the left, or right, sort of randomly and moved slightly downwards several times. Movement seemed random, just sort of listlessly floating around, and then it started rising up. As it rose, it became slightly more dim and moved up very, very slowly, appearing as if it were moving away from the earth at a very acute angle of ascent.  We live near an airport, so I see and hear planes coming and going all the time, and this did not appear to be a plane. The flashing lights were reminiscent of a police siren, and it was far too far away and/or small to be a plane. I observed it with binoculars, but could see no increased details. Eventually, after twenty to thirty minutes of slowly moving away and up it became too faint to view and by then the sun was up enough that we lost sight of it.  It continued moving in a Southwesterly direction for the duration of the event in an area of the sky that lies south of the airport I am near. Flatmate claimed to hear sounds, but I did not hear anything, and other aircrafts were regularly flying overhead, into and out of the airport to the east.

records.summary: 3 red, glowing objects hovering in Columbus, OH.
records.story: 3 red, glowing objects hovering in Columbus, OH I was letting the dog out around 10:30 p.m. when I looked up into the southwest sky in Columbus, Ohio.  Three red beams of light were shining brightly in the shape of a triangle.  What was most odd was that the object seemed to hover in the same location (unlike an airplane) for several minutes.  At first, I thought the object was shaped like a stealth bomber, except that it appeared white in color.  My other thoughts was that the red, glowing objects had white beams of light connecting them together. I ran inside to tell my husband and daughter to come outside to verify what I saw.  By the time they got outside, there were only two, red glowing lights connected by a single white beam of light.  My daughter saw the bottom one disappear first and then the top one followed suit.  My husband also saw the two lights fade away into the sky. During this time, I ran through my house to the backyard to see if they would travel in a typical flight path.  However, there were absolutely no signs of the objects.  Their disappearance was quite unusual in nature. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information. Normally, i would dismiss as a helicopter but have never seen one with such a blue light before.   As we talked, i watched as it slowly descended perfectly straight down then hovered still in the sky.  Then it glided straight and perfect to the right about a half fields distance.  Then it glided perfectly straight to the left in the opposite direction.  Then glided on the same perfectly straight path back to the middle and slowly descended perfectly straight down.  It was a perfect cross it traveled now that i think about it.  As far as I've known, there are no known air crafts that can move so perfectly and at such sharp angles.

records.summary: Dancing, darting, bright white sphere, opaque plasma, basketball size, seen by 2 people together.
records.story: Dancing, darting, bright white sphere, opaque plasma, basketball size, seen by 2 people together. A ball of light the consistency of plasma, bright as a welding arc, the size of a basketball dancing around a light at the top of a parking lot light, just like a humming bird flitting around a flower.  It stayed spherical but did occasionally slightly change shape like a fragile round balloon in the wind.  That's all it did.  Dance to and fro around the street light.  Just like a quick humming bird! No repeated pattern, just zoom, dart, hold, zoom, dart, hold, over and over, no more than 1 to 2 feet away from the light.  Occasionally, it darted in a straight line in a split second 100 feet out to the right and then flies back, then 50 feet to the left and come back.  It looked controlled somehow, like that hummingbird leaving and then deciding to come back to a flower. Its intensity was like a welding arc.  Intensely Bright!  The sky was pitch dark and the street lights were on at the corner of Morse Road and High Street, Columbus Ohio.  Two of us watched it at 5:00 am for at least 10 minutes 1.5 years ago.  I looked at the other man and said:  "Do you see what I see?"  Answer:  "Yea! Crazy! What is it?!   It was still going strong when I left, and I still am not sure what it was.  Not ball lightning.  Not static electricity dancing because of nearby high voltage.  Clear sky, not lightening. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness indicates that the date of the sighting is approximate.  PD))

records.summary: High speed lead craft leaves three others in its wake
records.story: High speed lead craft leaves three others in its wake It was my first Spring Quarter at the not-yet-named, “The Ohio State University.”  It was late afternoon, probably the middle of May, 1967, when I left my room, # 332, to call my best friend, in an adjacent dowm.  It was the inaugural year of Nosker House, my dorm in the newly opened north complex of residence halls.  He lived on the first floor of Drackett Tower, to my north, and on the west side of his building.  Although we had phones in our dorm rooms, they were only able to access in-house phones.  To call outside the dorm we had to use the phones located in the stairwell, mine was on the west side of the building. So here is my report. As I was waiting for my buddy to answer his phone - located in his room and able to access in-house and out-of-house calls – I looked up and saw four jets flying in a diamond formation.  I was intrigued by these jets as they flew east to west and were at an attitude of about ten-thirty as seen out my stairwell window.  I don’t know their altitude, but they were way up there!!!  No wings could be defined, but I had often seen jets (probably military since commercial aircraft don’t fly in formation) flying at this altitude.  As soon the phone was answered, I immediately asked, “Hey look out your window, can you see those four jets up there?"  I planned to give him more information as to their being a bit to the north, and quite high. In the time that it took me to utter those few words, the lead craft hit the accelerator and completely flew to the end of my visible horizon and out of my scope of visibility.  We are talking hundreds (?) thousands (?) of miles based on the altitude.  The three remaining jets continued at a snail’s pace, although I am sure they were travelling at a high rate of speed - for them.  There was no contrail, no noise heard - no deviation of direction, just an incredible display of speed like I had never seen before, or since - and that was 48 years ago. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness indicates that the date of the sighting is approximate.  PD))

records.summary: Amber Lightballs, six in series, spaced about two minutes apart track across sky at relatively low altitude and airspeed.
records.story: Amber Lightballs, six in series, spaced about two minutes apart track across sky at relatively low altitude and airspeed. Myself and a friend were sitting outside and we saw an amber light (ball) appear on the horizon, it was low, perhaps 5000 feet, no noise whatsoever, and traveling at the speed which one could say was similar to a small high performance prop aircraft, faster than a helicopter but not real real fast.  We watched it track closer and it took a gradual curve and we watched it as it slowly disappeared on the far horizon.  We then saw a second one, originating at the same point as the first one, it too followed a similar path. Subsequently, there were 3 or 4 more, and at one point we had eyeballs on two of them as one was fading and another had started.  I'm gonna say each one from start to finish was about two minutes. My friend lives in a neighborhood with curving streets all over so unfortunately I cannot give you an orientation as to North/South etc., as I'm not sure the exact direction where they first manifested since I have no clue as to which way the backyard faces. Note, there are a few similar reports.  Very interesting. No noise whatsoever. The color was almost exactly like a street lamp, the amberish ones. This morning, around 5:45 am, I am outside with the dog for his morning bathroom routine.  Noticed very bright light in the sky.  Assumed it was an airplane.  Noticed that there was no sound, however.   Light remained stationary for a few seconds, then the light seemed to move vertically skyward and away southeast.  I kept my eyes fixed on the light until it completely disappeared.  It looked as though the light went from very close and bright to nothing more than a very distant star, to nothing at all.

records.summary: Massive structure with blue lights flying across sky.
records.story: Massive structure with blue lights flying across sky Early winter of 2013, I stood out on my front porch to get some fresh air.  It was around 10:30pm.  I looked up to the sky because I saw blue light out the corner of my eye.  It was to the right.  At first I thought it was a shooting star because it was moving so fast.  But as it flew further from me, I saw blue light from the left as well.   That’s when I realized the lights were a part of the same structure.  It appeared to be on the wings of a massive sort of flattened crescent shaped structure.  And I mean massive.  It stretched from one side of the sky to the other.  If it were on the ground, it cover several miles.  I couldn’t see the center and body of it well, but I could see where the lights were.  The wings were thin and very aerodynamic looking.   The body of it was shadowy.  But, I could see the stars through the body of it as if it were kind of transparent.  It was very fast and extremely quiet.  That’s how I know it wasn’t man made.  I’m ex-military and I’ve seen most of what we can do.   Our technology is junk compared to this thing.  We cannot create something so massive and so fast, yet doesn’t make a sound as it zipped across the night sky.   I waited for news reports.  I just knew people were going to report it.  It was so large.  It was fast and there and gone in under a minute, but it was so large that I figured someone else had to see it.  '' I searched the news and internet.  No reports. I only told my kids about it.  I’m reporting this for the first time, and it feels good to tell someone.  I don’t feel so crazy anymore. I saw a similar picture of a UFO on a tv show a few days ago and that prompted me to find this website.  It wasn't the same.  But, close enough to get my attention.   I plan to draw a picture, the best I can, and submit it. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness indicates that the date of the sighting is approximate.  PD))

records.story: Today is May14, 2016, I woke to use the restroom this morning about 2am, I stepped out on my porch in Mill Springs, NC, and was shocked at how bright the night sky was, and how vivid the stars were.   I looked southwest toward gsp airport and noticed the very bright space station, or Venus or whatever and o was captivated by what I saw, the stars were moving eratically.  I looked north away from the airport and started noticing stars were chasing each other at high speeds yet no tail was visible, all research I done today by calling news Channel 4 and gsp tower cotrol, to see if they had seen anything was in vain, I guess I was the only one in north or South Carolina to witness the event.  They were in battle formations, I saw at least half a dozen aerial dogfights but not close up, they looked like stars but moved at incredible speeds.  I also seen that when these fights occurred the UFOs involved were suddenly enveloped in what I can only describe as a dark cloud formation, which obstructed a lot of the visual details.  I woke my gf to witness what I was seeing, more for my reassurance of sanity than anything else and they didn't let us down, we watched as they did tit for tat until dawn when it all stopped and the sky was clear. It is very surreal and kinda scary.  What has our government done!??  The grey alien agenda, secret deals trading human lives for alien tech??  I believe all the lies are coming out soon, and when it does, you need to be prepared for it!  The US is shooting down other entities for fear they will stop the Greys aliens and ultimately restrict giving out too much technology to a race that can't even get along in its on world with humans, how much more dangerous could it be for the other factions of Aliens that have no agenda except to observe and record.  If anyone else happened to see the events I spoke of in Polk County, NC, or surrounding states by all means please put it out here.  We quite possibly could all be in very grave danger, not just the! USA, but the entire human race.

records.summary: I have pics!
records.story: I have pics! Object descended; was red ball; slight tail.  Moved erratically but not too fast. Changed color, direction and speed.  The KEY element here is I have five photos taken from cell phone that are pretty definitive.  The last of the five shows round object with crescent lighting.  You can see distinctive round or disk shape.  The initial color was red; then multi-colored, then white and final color was green (the crescent lighting) before it slowly eased out of view behind roof of hotel I was staying at.  Pics show hotel in foreground to give a point of reference, size wise.  Lasted about 3 min.; went around hotel to see more however it was gone.

records.summary: I saw a total of three lights moving north to south with the city of Columbus till they disappeared.
records.story: I saw a total of three lights moving north to south with the city of Columbus till they disappeared based on distance and the light dimmed slowly as they moved away.  The first two lights moved about the same speed the third light was much slower and was in a different flight path to the left of the first two.  The second light I noticed  was followed by a flash of light in its path but further behind it.  These three lights all appeared to be similar to what you'll see when watching a satellite Passover, except for the flash of light which to me is still unexplainable.  I saw the same type flash on a light two mornings ago moving west to east over the north end of the Columbus.   My neighbor was with me this evening and witnessed the third light I saw within the 10 mins I was outside looking at the night sky.  I've never seen so many things going on in a short period of time like this.  Just wondering what's going on if anything....and what's up with the flashes of light in the path of these moving lights?

records.summary: An orange cylinder flew north in the sky and moved at a moderate speed silently away from us and disappeared.
records.story: An orange cylinder flew north in the sky and moved at a moderate speed silently away from us and disappeared. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Group of blinking objects/lights.  Soundless  Filmed with still and video cameras
records.story: Group of blinking objects/lights.  Soundless  Filmed with still and video cameras Was out photographing the moon, Venus, Mars, and Saturn. While focused on Venus, I saw 2 red lights or objects go past one above and 1 below Venus and about a degree apart.  They were blinking in synchrony.  Saw no body go over Venus, just the 2 lights, west to east.  Took pictures with an iphone. Then ran to a camcorder & turned it on.  I could still see the blinking red lights off and on.  There seemed to be more of them- at least 3 maybe 4.  They would make different patterns. There seemed to be white lights too.  Filmed dancing lights, flashes, move around, sometimes synchronous, blink, changed configuration, soundless, nothing like airplane lights, etc. (Still Photos and Video). They were soundless.  Know what drones, balloons, ad aircraft etc. looks like.  Have photography on Youtube and facebook (but not as good as the originals, but can give URLs).

records.summary: Bright orange ball.
records.story: Bright Orange Ball Bright orange light was stationary above a tree line a couple miles away then took off in a zig-zag pattern before disappearing in a small flash of red light.  Seen between Columbus and Scammon, Kansas.

((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Round, shiny objects flying in formation moved in ways not consistent with aircraft, balloons or anything else.
records.story: Round, shiny objects flying in formation moved in ways not consistent with aircraft, balloons or anything else I was in an industrial area of a large Southern city that boarders a very large military base.   Around 14:30 I was standing in a large lot looking up at the completely clear sky.  Almost immediately I saw two groups of 4 each objects approximately 500-700 feet in the sky moving in two formations of 4 each on "Y" shadows with the bottom of the "Y" being the lead in each group.  The objects were very shiny and each had a prominent white, thick, round, white circle within each object.  Both groups were moving East to West.  At first, I thought they might be balloons, mini-helicopters or drones.  But each group would move in formation and then suddenly completely stop, then shoot up, down, backwards and then race forward at amazingly speed.  Then at one point, both groups shot up until they could no longer be seen.  During these "maneuvers " several times one object in each formation would break away

records.summary: I live in the northeast part of Columbus. I saw a bright light in the distance and it slowly came closer, I think it was moving about 2
records.story: I live in the northeast part of Columbus.  I saw a bright light in the distance and it slowly came closer, I think it was moving about 200 mph at best guess.  It was at least 25,000 feet up and several miles, from my position when I first saw it.  I watched it til I could determine that there were no blinking lights on it indicating it was a plane.  It came from NW of the city and flew over the upper northeast portion of town.  I was able to see it clearly for about two minutes at it's closest point to my house, when it banked slightly and I could see 5 lights and the bottom of a chevron shaped craft.  I watched it for another two minutes as it continued to travel in a ESE direction.  It faded from sight in the distance ... I would like to be informed if anyone else reports this…

records.summary: Black triangle craft with 8 - 10 yellowish-white lights on side/red underbelly lights/quietly hums past window.
records.story: Black triangle craft with 8 - 10 yellowish-white lights on side/red underbelly lights/quietly hums past window. My girlfriend and I were about to lay down to go to sleep when she pointed out a craft in the distance.  She said it was sitting still until I looked out the window.  The craft moved very slowly going toward the East, somewhat hiding in the tree lines.  It then made a very smooth turn, heading toward the West this time, and came back into our view. The craft then very slowly hovered right past our window, there was probably 8 to 10 yellowish-white lights on the side we could see, and at least two red lights on the belly of the craft.  This thing was literally at the height of the power lines, made virtually no sound until it was passing right next to the house.  It made a very faint humming sound - we live really close to an airport so we're pretty familiar with airplane sounds and their landing lights. It was a black triangle shape from what we could make out. It was insane how close we were to this thing.  You could've probably pegged this thing with a rock, it was flying so low. And at the speed this thing hovered, any other aircraft would've definitely been stalling out.  I didn't take any pictures because my camera on my phone has awful quality. We plan to watch out the window again tonight, just in case we see anything. I plan on taking pictures and/or video this time, if anything happens.  I've seen two other ufo's when I was younger, but this one was definitely the closest encounter I've had.

records.summary: 6 to 7 bright white lights on triangular craft - North Columbus
records.story: 6 to 7 bright white lights on triangular craft - North Columbus My girlfriend and I were watching the sky again, and we saw something flying in the distance, the craft came from the same direction, and did the same exact movements as it had the night before.  It actually descended vertically with no horizontal movement.  We saw no red or green lights present on the craft.  (Indicating a commercial or even military aircraft.)  It came from the North, until it got around some trees, made a gradual 90 degree turn and began heading to the West.  (In the direction of the airport here.)  We see tons of planes coming in and landing all day, everyday.  This thing was not a commercial airliner. It was flying entirely too slow, too low, and was way too quiet to be a passenger airliner, and had too many lights on it.  (And in the wrong places/not having the correct lights for an airplane.)  It flew pretty slowly past the house, it was probably about 100 - 250 feet away (maybe a bit more) from the house, and it was flying at a pretty low altitude, I'd guess somewhere around maybe 200-400 feet area possibly.  I actually managed to snap a few quick pictures of the thing, which I will attach to this. What was odd to me was the fact that there weren't any other airplanes coming in for about 10 - 15 minutes before this craft came, and nothing came in to the airport for about 15 - 20 minutes after we saw the craft.  There is also an Air Force base pretty close by (Rickenbacker AFB), but that base is roughly 30 minutes to the South of us. This one did have a sound, like a plane - but a very, very quiet plane. (It was more quiet than a single prop airplane.) We didn't hear the noise of it until it was passing the house, and for a brief moment after it had already passed by the house. It had at least 6 - 7 bright white lights present on it. (That's only counting the lights on the left side and back side of the craft.) It was very dark, but it was most likely a black craft, and the way the lights were situated on the craft, it had to be a triangular craft. Note:  Normally we hear crickets outside all night long, but when this craft hovered past us, it was dead quiet outside with the occasional sound of vehicles on the nearby highways and the craft when it hovered by.

records.summary: Purple ball of light in night sky.  Sunday, July 15, 2012.  Columbus, OH.
records.story: Purple ball of light in night sky.  Sunday, July 15, 2012.  Columbus, OH. My brother went to the corner drug store and managed to capture a quick picture of of a purple ball of light in the night sky (pictured between the street lights on the right).   The picture was taken via a cheap cell phone at the the corner of Maple Canyon/161 in Columbus, OH, at roughly 9:35pm, on Sunday, July 15, 2012.  Just after he took the pictures (two back to back) he immediately called me in a panic to see if I could see it from the apartment (living roughly a quarter mile away to the north,m).   Unfortunately there are several tree lines so I didn't see it firsthand, but was fascinated by what he got a picture of.   He said the light was stationary and changed from purple to yellow, light blue to white, and then faded into blackness (visible for only a few moments).

records.summary: I walked outside for a smoke break on my nightshift and looked at the sky (to clear my head) and saw a blue orb zip across the sky.
records.story: I walked outside for a smoke break on my nightshift and looked at the sky (to clear my head) and saw a blue orb zip across the sky. Blue Orb that zipped across the sky.  Very clear.

records.summary: White light in clear sky, flickered then appeared as thinner chrome object, 10-15 seconds duration.
records.story: White light in clear sky, flickered then appeared as thinner chrome object, 10-15 seconds duration. While driving south on Maple Canyon (about 50 yards north of the Dublin-Granville Rd intersection) I came to a stop due to a red traffic light.  A flash of white light ahead in the clear blue sky caught my eye, at first thinking it was an airplane.   By judging the distance/height of the object, I would place it somewhere around 15,000 ft in the air, appearing to be about the diameter of 1.5-2 commercial airliners.  The white light (circular/oval shape) became smaller (about half the size), returned to its original size, then with a flash of chrome suddenly appearing (as if turning or changing shape and reflecting sunlight possibly), a thinner flat shape became visible and without the white circular/oval light.  While still stopped due to traffic I never lost focus of the object, but it then completely vanished.   No trails visible anywhere near where I witness the object, only clear blue skies.  The duration of the event was 10-15 seconds.

records.summary: Something woke me up. My body felt as if it was new. Something told me to look outside upwards and there it was in a circular shape but
records.story: Something woke me up.  My body felt as if it was new.  Something told me to look outside upwards and there it was in a circular shape but shaped like lines or something like the Stoneridge design and a light that was bringing something here and placing it on earth. Makes me feel as if the bad angel's are released.  My boyfriend seen it as well.  I tried to capture it on my cell but the only thing that showed up was a piece of the light coming from the center of it. I have many photos,  personal dealings and I've never seen this. Looked like a cloud in form.  But wasn't.

records.summary: I want to state first that my co-worker and I were both recently retired military individuals and very familiar with all kind of aircra
records.story: I want to state first that my co-worker and I were both recently retired military individuals and very familiar with all kind of aircraft.   He called me outside the building and stated there was a low flying aircraft headed from the north towards our building.  Several workers stepped outside and after a few minutes, realized it was a low flying black triangular shaped craft passing overhead.  The aircraft was approximately 200 yards from rear corner to rear corner.  There were white lights on each corner, a total of three lights.  There were no other lights visible.   The aircraft was so large and so low it felt like we could have thrown a rock and hit it.  There was absolutely no sound emitting from the craft.   It flew overhead very slowly and headed towards the main area of the Fort Benning military installation.  I should state that our location was almost adjacent to the military installation boundary and the craft was moving parallel to the boundary.  It continued moving in south trajectory, until it disappeared.   We all looked at each other and asked if anyone knew what we witnessed.  Everyone stated that they did not know what it was.  I was a UFO skeptic up to this point in time.  I do not make a judgement as to whether it was extra-terrestrial, or terrestrial, in nature.   I am reporting this because I want your organization to have the data in your files to accumulate your raw data and be able to compile it and have another data point to evaluate in comparison to other data.

records.summary: Stationary object moving in and out of view at dusk.
records.story: Stationary object moving in and out of view at dusk. Columbus, OH, June 25, 2017, 8:10 PM  See attached drawing. Object faded in and out of view three times.  Visible from 10 to 15 seconds each time.  At first, I thought I was seeing a cloud pass in front of the object but there were no clouds or fog between me and the object.  While visible, the object was not moving.  However, each time it would appear again it was in different portions of the sky, probably a mile distant from the position it was in maybe thirty seconds before.  It almost appeared to be an object that was somehow able to cloak itself from view but the mechanism for cloaking was slipping momentarily out of service. ((NUFORC Note:  Source of the report elects to remain anonymous; provides little contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Tuesday morning July 25,2017 at approximately 8:45am in the morning with a clear blue and beautiful sky while driving west bound on Hop
records.story: Tuesday morning July 25, 2017, at approximately 8:45am in the morning, with a clear blue and beautiful sky, while driving west bound on Hopkins Rd. in Columbus, Ohio, my wife asked me what is that in the sky.   I slowed down from 30mph to 10mph to watch what I call a "air vessel" three times the size of a Boeing 777, white in color with red rear fin, but the aircraft didn't have any wings, and made no sound.   The aircraft then headed east towards downtown Columbus, Ohio.   I am a US Air Force combat veteran of 12 yrs and I have never seen a aircraft like this.  It had no markings, decals or country designation.

records.summary: Woke up inside of a tanning bed-like enclosement, appeared to be traveling with high turbulence, alien zapped me.
records.story: Woke up inside of a tanning bed-like enclosement, appeared to be traveling with high turbulence, alien zapped me back unconscious Possible abduction?  Hard to say.. But here is an account of the incident.  I fell asleep on my couch in Columbus, OH at around 1:30 a.m. Eastern Standard Time on 7-8-17.  Then I woke up on my back, inside of what I equated to being an enclosed tanning bed-like apparatus.  It felt as if I was traveling at a high rate of speed and the ride was very turbulent.  I began to look around and one of the things I remember seeing is a worn down "yellow labeling" on the inside of whatever the hell I was enclosed in.  The next thing I know, at least my head was no longer enclosed as I saw an alien take an object and touched my forehead with it and I was "out cold".  I woke back up on couch in the exact same position I fell asleep on with my CPAP on just as it was prior to this "possible abduction".  I had no fear, not sure why..  In the ensuing minutes after waking up I tried to make sense of what had happened.  There was no missing time, I was back up within a half hour. Had a sick like feeling in my stomach, open waking up and its been on and off all day. Description of the alien I saw:  Structurally, it was similar to many of the common air craft aliens we see in our American pop culture documentaries (Short around 3 feet, thin body, big dark eyes, funny shaped head) accept this one had rather dark scaly skin, not true gray.  One the the things that stood out was the wide of its arm and forearm, it was the equivalent of a broomstick width the arm was the same width as the forearm.  I was unconscious seconds after he put the object between my eyebrows and forehead. Other information about me which you may or may not find relevant. Since the age of 8 years old I have been an experiencer of sleep paralysis -entity attacks, but even before this the paranormal world seemed to antagonize me at a really young age.  I can remember some things just before the age of two.  I've had thousands of negative nocturnal (non physical) attacks by paranormal entities, like smacking, prodding, choking and senses manipulation (I've also had a few positive ones like when I was tapped on the shoulder after falling asleep while feeding my infant son a bottle which caused the nipple to go adrift from his mouth.   Lately, I'd say within the last year, I've seen very bright lights in my dreams on more than one occasion.  I have been "spiritually probed" several times, mostly in the back of my head - cerebellum, but also in the navel and unfortunately my fudge tunnel a time or two. I'm not psychotic or mental, I've never done drugs, and rarely consume alcohol.

records.summary: Green streak growing in size moving from west to east at about + 600ft elevation over I-185 looking south
records.story: Green streak, growing in size, moving from west to east, at about + 600ft elevation over I-185.  looking south toward the Columbus, GA, airport.   Light was small, at first, and then began to grow in length moving to the east.  Appeared to have oval shape at eastern side of the trail; with skinnier diminishing trail to the west.   Light flowed smoothly across the sky with no jerky motions and was completely silent.   Observed the sky in the area for about 3-4 minutes, with no other lights observed in the sky.   The streak of slow moving light appeared to be thicker than should be expected at that height (in comparison to shooting stars I have seen in the past).   Did not appear to be a light from the airport or a green laser.

records.summary: Two balls of orange light, dropping smaller orange, flashing, objects.
records.story: Two balls of orange light, dropping smaller orange, flashing, objects. My fiancée and I were sitting on the porch and noticed an odd, orange circle of light cross  the sky to the east of us, heading northeast.  Smaller balls of light detached itself and appeared to be falling from it.   We walked down our outside balcony to follow its path and it suddenly disappeared.  About two minutes later, another craft bearing the same description with little orange flashes dropping from it followed along slowly in the same flight path.   We were able to follow its flight path and watched it, when suddenly, it winked out and was nowhere to be seen.   Both were silent on their flights.   About three minutes after the last disappeared, a CPD helicopter loudly flew in the direction they vanished from.

records.summary: Was on the W side of Columbus, OH, and just happened to look up and thought it was just another jet at high altitude heading south e
records.story: Was on the west side of Columbus, Ohio, and just happened to look up and thought it was just another jet at high altitude heading south east until it started making almost perfect circles and then come to a stop and head in another direction and do the same thing over and over.   It was super bright from the sun reflecting light off of it. it was really cool to watch.  When it was done acting all crazy and putting a really cool show it just faded out.  I stood and waited for about tan minutes but never seen anything come back in view.  I so wish I could have got it on video.

records.summary: I just got off work and was driving on Stelzer rd and it was raining, I saw a blue flash and  then about 2 to 4 seconds later another B
records.story: I just got off work and was driving on Stelzer rd and it was raining, I saw a blue flash and  then about 2 to 4 seconds later another Bright Blue Flash it lit up the sky, I thought maybe a plane crashed, but it was like a neon Blue so bright you could see the clouds and it was pitch dark.  I have a coworker who saw the same two blue flashes.  It was south over the horizon, I think it was two meteors that hit.

records.story: Approx 1215am while driving on 270 south, a blue light went across the sky toward airport then a sudden blue flash. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: Bright light in the sky over Columbus, Georgia.
records.story: Bright light in the sky over Columbus, Georgia. I bright light appeared in the western sky and lasted about 5 sec then faded.  After about a minute the light reappeared in the same location and lasted for another 5 sec before fading.  I thought it my be an aircraft but they maintain their lights at night.

records.summary: Driving on Henderson Rd. towards High St with my boyfriend, we saw what appeared to be 2 connected oval/disk-like craft.
records.story: Driving down Henderson RD towards High St with my boyfriend, we saw what appeared to be 2 connected oval/disk like crafts that had bright glow.  Upon inspection, did not appear to be a drone or blimp.   I honestly have never seen anything like it before and was shocked, as it was a busy evening and there were many people out and about.   We watched and observed for as long as we could, whilst driving, and when our view was blocked by trees for a few minutes, we could not longer see the UFO.

records.summary: Shiny, white ball flying next to our plane.
records.story: Shiny, white ball flying next to our plane. Approximately 30 minutes into my flight from Columbus, Ohio, to Dallas, Texas, I saw a shiny white ball with an opaque, white "finger" type cloud behind it, connected to the ball, coming toward the plane.  It was very close to us,right in front of the right wing.  Behind it,perpendicular to it and the plane, was what looked like a jet trail that we can see from the ground. (It was dissipating)  The shiny white UFO, for lack of a better discription,"flew" without any fins or propellers.  It flew along side us until we flew too far to see it anymore, its trail dissipating like a jet trail.

records.summary: large, flat black triangle passed overhead, observed by two adults, one a flight attendant.  ((MUFON report))
records.story: large, flat black triangle passed overhead, observed by two adults, one a flight attendant. A young woman, outside for a smoke, noted an approaching red light, southward bound.  Her mother was summoned and both watched as a large, flat black triangle passed overhead.  The object had a large central red light and a smaller red light near the leading vertex.  Four white lights were spaced unevenly along each of the leading edges.  The red lights pulsated slightly, while the white ones strobed irregularly at varying intensities.  What looked like smoke was emitted from the rear.  The UFO seemed to be 15,000 to 20,000 feet high, travelled linearly, and sometimes hovered.  Moving on an ascending southwest track, it was lost behind trees.  The main witness works as a flight attendant and is also a nursing student.  15 mins (MUFON Case 60475)

records.summary: On 2/5/18 at 6:40pm,my wife and I went out to watch the ISS fly by.  It was going to be a straight over head fly by. When we w
records.story: On 2/5/18 at 6:40pm my wife and I went out to watch the space station fly by. It was going to be a straight overhead fly by.   When we were watching it, at about 70 degrees from us I saw something unexpected.  A light appeared just to the south of the station.  It looked just like a star had appeared from nothing and lasted maybe 2 seconds.  I didn't say anything about it, thinking I would tell my wife later.  About 5 seconds later it appeared again.  Same thing, looking like a star and lasting about 2 seconds before disappearing again. Again I didn't say anything. Then my wife says did you see that light.  She said she saw it twice, just the same as I witnessed it.  It was about 1 inch distance if you took a ruler to measure it the sky, south of the station. I don't know what it was, it just blinked on and then off twice.

records.summary: I was standing outside smoking and a black triangle craft with lights at its corners flew right over me.  ((anonymous report))
records.story: I was standing outside smoking and a black triangle craft with lights at its corners flew right over me.  Didn't make a sound until it started changing directions.  Moving VERY fast. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))

records.summary: A blue light that looked like a plane shot off at light speed after 1 minute of normal speed.
records.story: A blue light that looked like a plane shot off at light speed after 1 minute of normal speed. My close friend (to this day in 2018) and I were driving from Houston, TX to Austin, TX between 11pm-2am sometime during the 3rd week of July. I merged on TX 71 West from Interstate-10 in Columbus, Texas.  About 20 miles down TX 71 West, I noticed what I thought was an airplane about 30-50k feet up, with blue glowing beacon lights.  Even back then, when I was 18 years old, I knew that no airplane (to my knowledge) had glowing blue lights.  I pointed this out to my friend (also 18 then) and we were watching the light move across the sky like an airplane, as I explained to him for about two minutes how planes don't have blue lights and I wonder if it's military etc; it's hard to describe this how I saw it; so bare with me.  The light was  moving slowly across the sky like a plane - very normal, then in 1 second it shot off at light speed into the sky - - NOT across the sky into the horizon, I mean in to the clouds directly away from the ground, the way it zipped off, I have and never will see anything like it again. That object zipped away so fast, like a movie, I think about it all the time up to this day, and nobody believes us.  It was not a comet, I see those weekly when I am in Texas.  I investigated all the Texas July 2011 reports and nobody has reported this, even though somebody near Columbus, TX, HAD to have seen it. The only color I saw was blue, and the craft was not close to the ground.  This was at 1am with good visibility.  Whatever this light was, it left the Earth at light speed.  I have personally never seen a UFO, or anything abnormal in the sky aside from this incident when I was 18 back in 2011.  My girlfriend at the time thought I was crazy. ((NUFORC Note:  Source of report indicates that the date of the sighting is approximate.  PD))

records.summary: Facing E and saw 3 brights lights in the sky.  The lights almost seem to hover and one went past me quickly.  ((anonymous report))
records.story: Driving home and turned on a street facing East and saw 3 brights lights in the sky.  The lights almost seem to hover and one went past me quickly.  I couldn't tell what type of aircraft I saw.   I kept driving to try an get closer but never seemed like I could.   I turned back around to go home heading west, and all of a sudden the second light for part me. ((NUFORC Note:  Witness elects to remain totally anonymous; provides no contact information.  PD))
